title: Load Balancer
description: Load balancing refers to efficiently distributing incoming network traffic across a group of backend servers, also known as a server farm or server pool.
key-ideas: Services, servers, networks, network segments, or power.
May be associated with redundancy and/or scalability.
Algorithms: round robin, random, hash, IP hash, least connections, least time.
Can often automatically detect new servers or service providers and add them to the pool (scalable).
